<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/08/amazon-ceo-wants-closer-techmilitary-ties?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bezos: Big Tech Should Play Defense
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="alexa reunite my family sign" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc1ODI2MDI1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Zach Gibson/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Jeff Bezos <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/07/bezos-says-country-in-trouble-if-big-tech-turns-its-back-on-the-pentagon.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">thinks</a> the U.S. military should work more closely with the largest American tech firms because “We are the good guys, I really do believe that.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Speaking at the Reagan National Defense Forum this weekend, the Amazon CEO warned that China was a growing threat to U.S. tech supremacy. “If big tech is going to turn their backs on the Department of Defense, this country is in trouble, that just can’t happen,” he said. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who’s turning their backs</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bezos didn’t name names, but it’s pretty clear he was subtweeting Google. Last year, the company said it <a href="https://gizmodo.com/google-plans-not-to-renew-its-contract-for-project-mave-1826488620?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wouldn’t renew</a> a contract with the Department of Defense for Project Maven, a program that used Google’s artificial intelligence to analyze drone footage.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>While Google was still actively working on Project Maven, more than 3,100 employees </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2018/04/04/google-workers-urge-ceo-sundar-pichai-to-pull-out-of-pentagon-project.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed a petition</a></span><span> requesting that CEO Sundar Pichai cancel the contract. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“We believe that Google should not be in the business of war,” </span><span><a href="https://static01.nyt.com/files/2018/technology/googleletter.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">it read</a></span><span>. “We cannot outsource the moral responsibility of our technologies to third parties.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Bezos disagrees </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“I know it’s complicated but you know, do you want a strong national defense or don’t you? I think you do. So we have to support that,” he said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon <em>is </em>supporting that, actively <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/05/22/technology/amazon-facial-recognition.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pushing its tech</a> to law enforcement and national security agencies. Its controversial facial recognition software, Rekognition, has been used by police departments around the country. In the summer of 2018, it <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2018/10/23/amazon-met-with-ice-officials-over-facial-recognition-system-that-could-identify-immigrants/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pitched</a> Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officials on using Rekognition. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Most recently, Amazon lost out to Microsoft on a $10 billion cloud computing contract with the Pentagon. Amazon </span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/amazon-blames-trump-for-getting-passed-over-on-pentagons-jedi-contract-judge-says-2019-12-05?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed a lawsuit</a></span><span> earlier this month alleging President Trump’s apparent bias against Bezos and Amazon hurt its chances. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>To Bezos, companies providing the U.S. military with the best technology available is not a decision to be made but a patriotic duty. “This is not a sporting competition. You don’t want to fight fair,” he said.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TELECOM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/08/tmobile-sprint-defend-merger-court?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Deal or No Deal?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="T-Mobile and Sprint" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc1ODIzODY4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, T-Mobile and Sprint <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/08/t-mobile-and-sprint-begin-battle-to-win-merger-approval.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will defend</a> their planned $26.5 billion merger in a Manhattan court. What’s at stake: Both the future of the U.S. wireless industry and Dick Wolf’s reputation for owning NYC courtroom scenes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The case for: </strong>T-Mobile and Sprint, the respective No. 3 and No. 4 U.S. carriers, say the only way to keep up with top dogs Verizon and AT&T in terms of pricing and innovation like 5G is to join forces. Also precedent—the Justice Department and the Federal Communications Commission already greenlit the deal.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Those signoffs followed </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/40684852c3b5a9f5d1564c6b97ca119d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">T-Mobile’s promise</a></span><span> to support Dish's quest to become a new mobile carrier. How a satellite TV company you haven’t thought about since 2010 can compete in the wireless industry is a big question mark, but it was enough to satiate some antitrust busters.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The case against:</strong> 14 state attorneys general from NY, California, and more will argue the merger cauterizes competition and could cost consumers billions. Also precedent—the DOJ blocked AT&T’s attempt to buy T-Mobile in 2011.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the trial’s <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/t-mobile-and-sprint-head-to-court-what-you-need-to-know/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expected</a> to last several weeks. See you around Valentine’s Day for the decision.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F12%2F08%2Ftmobile-sprint-defend-merger-court" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=What%E2%80%99s+at+stake%3A+The+future+of+the+U.S.+wireless+industry&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/08/tmobile-sprint-defend-merger-court&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F12%2F08%2Ftmobile-sprint-defend-merger-court&title=T-Mobile+and+Sprint+Defend+Their+Merger+in+Court+&source=www.morningbrew.com&summary=What%E2%80%99s+at+stake%3A+The+future+of+the+U.S.+wireless+industry" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>

</table>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
UTILITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/08/pge-takes-one-step-forward-new-settlement?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
PG&E Takes One Step Forward
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Friday, California utility PG&E agreed to a tentative <a href="https://apnews.com/4f3e3da8d1d84ad9b1a5fabe0222b6d1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$13.5 billion settlement</a> with wildfire victims. This is big: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The settlement resolves all major claims from fires in 2017 and 2018, including the 2018 Camp Fire that killed 85 people.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It also settles claims from high-profile fires in 2015 and 2016. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That timeline should tell you:</strong> PG&E’s equipment has played a role in a number of Northern California fires. It’s been <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/01/business/energy-environment/pge-california-newsom.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dragged by politicians</a> including Gov. Gavin Newsom, who’s argued the utility should completely revamp its structure. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For now, the settlement will a) help the victims to rebuild and b) help the utility emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy, which it entered in January <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-california-wildfire-pg-e-us/bankrupt-pge-reaches-13-5-billion-settlement-with-california-wildfire-victims-idUSKBN1YB03M?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">facing $30+ billion</a> in <span>potential wildfire-related liabilities</span>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>the settlement still has to be approved by the U.S. Bankruptcy Court. But the bigger deadline is June 30, 2020, when PG&E will have to complete its bankruptcy reorganization plans.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/08/hong-kong-protests-checking-six-months?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hong Kong Protests: Checking in at Six Months
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Hong Kong protestors " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc1ODI2MjI0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Anthony Kwan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s been 183 days since a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/six-months-on-hong-kong-protesters-fill-city-streets-to-press-demands-11575793436?mod=hp_lead_pos5&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mass rally</a> kicked off pro-democracy protests and a subsequent political crisis in semiautonomous Hong Kong. So far, the HK government has <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/05/hong-kong-authorities-are-keeping-an-open-mind-to-economic-support.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pledged about $3.2 billion</a> to prop up the economy during the unrest. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To mark the anniversary, protestors put on the city’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-08/biggest-hong-kong-protest-in-months-signals-more-unrest-in-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest</a> demonstration in months this weekend. Organizers say 800,000 people <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-50704137?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">participated</a>; Hong Kong police say 183,000 were there at the peak.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The march was </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/8ef6d7568e2c80c23f1a60c8bb0f3276?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">largely peaceful</a></span><span>, a welcome change from the Molotov cocktails and rubber bullets of previous demonstrations.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What they want: </strong>Protestors say they’ll continue until HK Chief Executive Carrie Lam meets five demands, including more democratic elections and amnesty for arrested protestors. And after pro-democracy candidates won recent district elections <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/24/battered-hong-kong-votes?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in a landslide</a>, they want those changes yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The big picture: </strong>Most experts and four out of five newsletter writers agree that Lam, armed with Chinese President Xi Jinping’s support, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/07/world/asia/hong-kong-protests-us-chamber-commerce.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">isn’t likely</a> to give in, no matter how many times she’s called “beleaguered.”</p>

href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/07/bezos-says-country-in-trouble-if-big-tech-turns-its-back-on-the-pentagon.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethinks\u003c/a\u003e the U.S. military should work more closely with the largest American tech firms because “We are the turning their backs\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBezos didn’t name names, but it’s pretty clear he was subtweeting Google. Last year, the company said it \u003ca href=\"https://gizmodo.com/google-plans-not-to-renew-its-contract-for-project-mave-1826488620?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewouldn’t renew\u003c/a\u003e a contract with the Department of Defense for Project Maven, a program that used Google’s artificial intelligence to analyze drone footage.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhile Google was still actively working on Project Maven, more than 3,100 employees \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2018/04/04/google-workers-urge-ceo-sundar-pichai-to-pull-out-of-pentagon-project.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esigned a petition\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e requesting that CEO Sundar Pichai cancel the contract. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“We believe that Google should not be in the business of war,” \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://static01.nyt.com/files/2018/technology/googleletter.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eit read\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. “We cannot outsource the moral responsibility of our technologies to third parties.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBezos disagrees \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“I know it’s complicated but you know, do you want a strong national defense or don’t you? I think you do. So we have to support that,” he said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmazon \u003cem\u003eis \u003c/em\u003esupporting that, actively \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2018/05/22/technology/amazon-facial-recognition.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epushing its tech\u003c/a\u003e to law enforcement and national security agencies. Its controversial facial recognition software, Rekognition, has been used by police departments around the country. In the summer of 2018, it \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2018/10/23/amazon-met-with-ice-officials-over-facial-recognition-system-that-could-identify-immigrants/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epitched\u003c/a\u003e Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officials on using Rekognition. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMost recently, Amazon lost out to Microsoft on a $10 billion cloud computing contract with the Pentagon. Amazon \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/amazon-blames-trump-for-getting-passed-over-on-pentagons-jedi-contract-judge-says-2019-12-05?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled a lawsuit\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e earlier this month alleging President Trump’s apparent bias against Bezos and Amazon hurt its chances. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eTo Bezos, companies providing the U.S. military with the best technology available is not a decision to be made but a patriotic duty. “This is not a sporting competition. You don’t want to fight fair,” he said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F12%2F08%2Famazon-ceo-wants-closer-techmilitary-ties\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc1ODIzODY4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, T-Mobile and Sprint \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/08/t-mobile-and-sprint-begin-battle-to-win-merger-approval.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill defend\u003c/a\u003e their planned $26.5 billion merger in a Manhattan court. What’s at stake: Both the future of the U.S. wireless industry and Dick Wolf’s reputation for owning NYC courtroom scenes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe case for: \u003c/strong\u003eT-Mobile and Sprint, the respective No. 3 and No. 4 U.S. carriers, say the only way to keep up with top dogs Verizon and AT\u0026T in terms of pricing and innovation like 5G is to join forces. Also precedent—the Justice Department and the Federal Communications Commission already greenlit the deal.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThose signoffs followed \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/40684852c3b5a9f5d1564c6b97ca119d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eT-Mobile’s promise\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to support Dish's quest to become a new mobile carrier. How a satellite TV company you haven’t thought about since 2010 can compete in the wireless industry is a big question mark, but it was enough to satiate some antitrust busters.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe case against:\u003c/strong\u003e 14 state attorneys general from NY, California, and more will argue the merger cauterizes competition and could cost consumers billions. Also precedent—the DOJ blocked AT\u0026T’s attempt to buy T-Mobile in 2011.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe trial’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/t-mobile-and-sprint-head-to-court-what-you-need-to-know/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpected\u003c/a\u003e to last several weeks. Forward\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Friday, California utility PG\u0026E agreed to a tentative \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/4f3e3da8d1d84ad9b1a5fabe0222b6d1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$13.5 billion settlement\u003c/a\u003e with wildfire victims. This is big: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe settlement resolves all major claims from fires in 2017 and 2018, including the 2018 Camp Fire that killed 85 people.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt also settles claims from high-profile fires in 2015 and 2016. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat timeline should tell you:\u003c/strong\u003e PG\u0026E’s equipment has played a role in a number of Northern California fires. It’s been \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/01/business/energy-environment/pge-california-newsom.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edragged by politicians\u003c/a\u003e including Gov. Gavin Newsom, who’s argued the utility should completely revamp its structure. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor now, the settlement will a) help the victims to rebuild and b) help the utility emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy, which it entered in January \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-california-wildfire-pg-e-us/bankrupt-pge-reaches-13-5-billion-settlement-with-california-wildfire-victims-idUSKBN1YB03M?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efacing $30+ billion\u003c/a\u003e in \u003cspan\u003epotential wildfire-related liabilities\u003c/span\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ethe settlement still has to be approved by the U.S. Bankruptcy Court. But the bigger deadline is June 30, 2020, when PG\u0026E will have to complete its bankruptcy reorganization plans.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/six-months-on-hong-kong-protesters-fill-city-streets-to-press-demands-11575793436?mod=hp_lead_pos5\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" semiautonomous Hong Kong. So far, the HK government has \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/05/hong-kong-authorities-are-keeping-an-open-mind-to-economic-support.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epledged about $3.2 billion\u003c/a\u003e to prop up the economy during the unrest. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo mark the anniversary, protestors put on the city’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-08/biggest-hong-kong-protest-in-months-signals-more-unrest-in-2020?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest\u003c/a\u003e demonstration in months this weekend. Organizers say 800,000 people \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-50704137?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eparticipated\u003c/a\u003e; Hong Kong police say 183,000 were there at the peak.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe march was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/8ef6d7568e2c80c23f1a60c8bb0f3276?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elargely peaceful\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a welcome change from the Molotov cocktails and rubber bullets of previous demonstrations.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat they want: \u003c/strong\u003eProtestors say they’ll continue until HK Chief Executive Carrie Lam meets five demands, including more democratic elections and amnesty for arrested protestors. And after pro-democracy candidates won recent district elections \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/24/battered-hong-kong-votes?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ein a landslide\u003c/a\u003e, they want those changes yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe big picture: \u003c/strong\u003eMost experts and four out of five newsletter writers agree that Lam, armed with Chinese President Xi Jinping’s support, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/07/world/asia/hong-kong-protests-us-chamber-commerce.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eisn’t likely\u003c/a\u003e to give in, no matter how many times she’s called “beleaguered.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
